Dieses Datenelement kann redundant sein, wenn die Modalität eindeutig im „Name der Studie“ dargestellt wird. Alternativ ist es möglicherweise auch möglich, die „Modalität“ automatisch aus einem codierten „Name der Studie“ auszufüllen. Es wird empfohlen, die „Modalität“ mit einem Wertesatz zu codieren, z. B. mit dem Wertesatz DICOM CID 29 Acquisition Modality. Entspricht ImagingStudy.modality in FHIR und Modality (0008, 0060) in DICOM.

at0092.1.description: Eindeutige Kennung für die vom Bildgebungsgerät zugewiesene Bildgebungsstudie.
at0092.1.comment: Entspricht der Study Instance UID (0020.000D) in DICOM und ImagingStudy.identifier in FHIR.

at0059.1.description: Vorschlag für weitere Bildgebung, Untersuchungen und/oder Überweisung und dazugehörige Begründung.
at0059.1.comment: Dieses Datenelement hat die Kardinalität 0..*, um mehr als eine Angabe von Empfehlung zu ermöglichen. Formelle Anordnungen für zusätzliche bildgebende Untersuchungen, Prüfungen sollten unter Verwendung eines INSTRUCTION-Archetyps wie INSTRUCTION.service_request dargestellt werden.

at0014.1.description: Die Beschreibung der relevanten klinischen Anamnese, die einen Kontext für die Untersuchung und Interpretation der Ergebnisse liefert.
at0014.1.comment: Alternativ kann dieses Datenelement einen RM-Link zu klinischen Informationen enthalten, die in der ursprünglichen Untersuchungsanfrage bereitgestellt wurden oder sich an anderer Stelle in der Gesundheitsakte befinden.

at0057.1.description: Die Beschreibung der Qualität der Untersuchung.
at0057.1.comment: Zum Beispiel: die Art jeglicher Einschränkungen und deren Auswirkung auf die Interpretation, Empfehlung zur Wiederholung der Untersuchung oder ob eine alternative Beurteilungsmethode geeigneter sein könnte.

at0058.1.description: Ein einzelnes Wort, eine Phrase oder eine kurze Beschreibung, die einen möglichen Zustand oder eine mögliche Diagnose darstellt.
at0058.1.comment: Dieses Datenelement kommt mehrfach vor, um mehr als eine Angabe von Differentialdiagnose zu ermöglichen. Wenn möglich, wird eine Codierung mit einer Terminologie wie SNOMED-CT bevorzugt. Dieses Datenelement ist als sich gegenseitig ausschließend zu „Bildgebende Diagnose“ zu betrachten, also jeweils nur entweder „Bildgebende Diagnose“ oder „Bildgebende Differentialdiagnose“ in einer Instanz des Archetyps „Bildgebendes Untersuchungsergebnis“.

at0097.1.description: Digitale Position der Vergleichsbildinhalte und Metadaten.
at0097.1.comment: Diese Position identifiziert den Netzwerkdienst, der den Zugriff (zum Speichern, Anzeigen, Abfragen oder Abrufen) für die Studie bereitstellt. Entspricht ImagingStudy.endpoint in FHIR.

at0098.1.description: Digitale Position der Bildinhalte und Metadaten.
at0098.1.comment: Diese Position identifiziert den Netzwerkdienst, der den Zugriff (zum Speichern, Anzeigen, Abfragen oder Abrufen) für die Studie bereitstellt. Entspricht ImagingStudy.endpoint in FHIR.

at0072.1.description: Der Status des Ergebnisses der bildgebenden Untersuchung als Ganzes.
at0072.1.comment: Die Werte wurden mit dem Status von Diagnostic report im FHIR abgeglichen, mit Ausnahme von „Entered in error“, das nur für ein datenaustausch-orientiertes Paradigma relevant ist. Andere lokale Codes/Begriffe können über die "Choice of" vom Text-Datentyp verwendet werden. In den meisten Anwendungsfällen ist jeweils nur ein Status anwendbar, jedoch erlaubt dieses Datenelement mehrere Vorkommen für die Anwendungsfälle, in denen eine Vielzahl von Status-Typen angegeben werden müssen, normalerweise innerhalb eines Templates. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.status in FHIR.

at0071.1.description: Der Zeitpunkt, an dem der „Status des Gesamtergebnisses“ bestimm wurde.

at0055.1.description: Beschreibung der einfachen Körperstelle oder -region, die für die Bildgebung bestimmt ist.
at0055.1.comment: Wenn die Körperstelle im Text oder Code für „Name der Studie“ angegeben ist, kann dieses Feld überflüssig sein. Eine Codierung von „Zielgebiet“ mit einer Terminologie, wie z. B. SNOMED CT, ist wünschenswert. Entspricht ImagingStudy.series.bodySite in FHIR.

at0093.1.description: Details zu Bildern aus einer früheren Studie, die zum Vergleich mit der berichteten Studie verwendet wurden.

at0056.1.description: Die Beschreibung zum Vergleich dieser Untersuchung mit früheren ähnlichen Studien.
at0056.1.comment: Verwenden Sie dieses Datenelement auch, um anzugeben, ob keine Vergleichsbilder und/oder Berichte verfügbar sind. Details zu den zum Vergleich verwendeten Bildern können im CLUSTER „Vergleichstudie Details“ im Archetyp-Teil "Protocol" erfasst werden.

at0094.1.description: Der Name der durchgeführten bildgebenden Vergleichsuntersuchung.

at0031.1.description: Eindeutige Kennung für den Auftrag der bildgebenden Untersuchung, vergeben durch den radiologischen Dienst.
at0031.1.comment: Entspricht dem HL7 Filler Order Identifier oder dem DICOM Accession number attribute (0008,0050).

at0108.1.description: Position/Lage der Person während der bildgebenden Untersuchung.

at0105.1.description: Vom radiologischen Dienst erstellte Beschreibung oder Klassifizierung der Studie.
at0105.1.comment: Entspricht ImagingStudy.description in FHIR und Study description (0008, 1030) in DICOM. Mögliche DICOM-Beispiele: MR BREAS, UNIT; NEURO^HEAD oder MR BREASTUNI UE.

at0106.1.description: Link zu vollständigen Details aller während der Studie durchgeführten Bildgebungen.
at0106.1.comment: Typischerweise wurden beim Referenzieren von Bildern die DICOM-fähigen Modalitäten verwendet, aber dieses Datenfeld bietet eine alternative Methode für den Zugriff auf die Bilder. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.imagingStudy in FHIR.

at0104.1.description: Eindeutige Kennung für den vom Radiologiedienst vergebenen Bildgebungsbericht.
at0104.1.comment: Da pro Studie eine Instanz dieses Archetyps verwendet wird, kann diese Identifikation verwendet werden, um mehr als eine Bildgebungsstudie in einem einzigen kompakten Bericht zu verbinden. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.identifier in FHIR.

at0002.1.description: Standardwert, ein undefinierter/s Zeitpunkt oder Intervallereignis, das explizit im Template oder zur Laufzeit der Anwendung definiert werden kann.

at0048.1.description: Die Beschreibung von Faktoren, welche noch nicht an anderer Stelle erfasst werden, die Untersuchungsbefunde und / oder -ergebnisse beeinflussen können.

at0049.1.description: Beschreibung des radiologischen Verfahrens, das zur Erfassung der Studie verwendet wurde.
at0049.1.comment: Verwenden Sie dieses Datenelement, um eine Zusammenfassung der technischen Prozedur zu beschreiben, einschließlich technischer Einschränkungen oder Abweichungen von den normalen technischen Verfahren. Zum Beispiel: "5-mm-Axialbilder von den Lungenbasen durch die Schambeinfuge wurden nach Verabreichung von intravenösem und oralem Kontrastmittel aufgenommen. Aus den Quelldaten wurden koronale und sagittale neu formatierte Bilder erstellt."

at0004.1.description: Der Name der durchgeführten bildgebenden Untersuchung.
at0004.1.comment: Zum Beispiel: „CT Abdomen“, „Doppler-Ultraschall der Nierenarterie“ oder „Röntgenaufnahme des Brustkorbs“. Es wird dringend empfohlen, eine Terminologie zu verwenden, vorzugsweise einen Begriff, der sowohl die Modalität als auch die anatomische Lokalisation angibt, sofern möglich. Beispiele für mögliche Terminologien sind die LOINC Imaging Document Codes, RadLex Playbook oder SNOMED-CT. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.code in FHIR.

at0027.1.description: Angaben zur Anforderung einer einzelnen bildgebenden Untersuchung.

at0026.2.description: Angaben über den Dienst, die Organisation oder die Person, die die bildgebende Untersuchung durchführt.

at0029.1.comment: Dies kann in Situationen nützlich sein, in denen die angeforderte Untersuchung von der durchgeführten Untersuchung abweicht.

at0006.2.description: Strukturierte Angaben über die Körperstelle oder -region, die für die Bildgebung bestimmt ist.
at0006.2.comment: Wenn die Körperstelle durch einen Code im "Name der Studie" angegeben wird, kann dieses Datenelement überflüssig sein.

at0028.1.description: Eindeutige Kennung für den Auftrag der bildgebenden Untersuchung, vom Anforderer vergeben.
at0028.1.comment: Entspricht der HL7 Placer Order Identifier.

at0008.1.description: Die Beschreibung oder Zusammenfassung aller klinischen Ergebnisse.

at0063.1.description: Die Beurteilung der Qualität der Untersuchung.
at0063.1.comment: Es wird empfohlen, die Qualität der Bildgebung mit einer Wertemenge zu codieren. Zum Beispiel: „ausgezeichnet, gut, mittelmäßig, schlecht und nicht diagnostisch“ oder „angemessen, suboptimal und unzureichend“.

at0087.1.description: Name des radiologischen Verfahrens, das zur Erfassung der Studie verwendet wurde.
at0087.1.comment: Die Codierung des „Technischen Verfahrens“ mit einer Terminologie ist erlaubt. Mehrere Vorkommen ermöglichen die Identifizierung einer oder mehrerer Techniken.

at0062.1.description: Beschreibung des klinischen Verfahrens oder andere klinische Aspekte, die zur Erfassung der Studie verwendet wurden.
at0062.1.comment: Verwenden Sie dieses Datenelement, um eine Zusammenfassung des klinischen Verfahrens, der Patientenpositionierung, Eingriffe wie Valsalva-Manöver und der Verabreichung von Kontrastmitteln, Radiopharmaka und/oder Behandlungen als Teil der Bildgebungsstudie zu beschreiben. Zum Beispiel: „80 ml Isovue-370 wurden intravenös unter Verwendung einer Bolus-Tracking-Technik verabreicht, die auf die Hauptpulmonalarterie zentriert war“. Es kann auch verwendet werden, um einen Überblick über aufgetretene Probleme, Komplikationen oder Nebenwirkungen darzustellen.

at0061.1.description: Die Beschreibung des Grundes für die ursprüngliche Untersuchungsanfrage.
at0061.1.comment: Auch bekannt als „Klinische Fragestellung“ oder „Klinische Frage“.

at0088.1.description: Identifizierung des klinischen Verfahrens oder Managements, das zur Erfassung der Studie verwendet wurde.

at0021.1.description: Kurz beschriebene, klinisch relevante Interpretation aller bildgebenden Befunde und gegebenenfalls ein Vergleich zu früheren Studien.
at0021.1.comment: Auch als „Beurteilung“ oder „Gesamteindruck“ bezeichnet. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.conclusion in FHIR.

at0044.1.description: Strukturierte Informationen zu den bildgebenden Befunden, die auf eine bestimmte Körperstruktur oder -region abzielen.

at0020.1.description: Ein einzelnes Wort, eine Phrase oder eine kurze Beschreibung, die einen wahrscheinlichen Zustand oder eine wahrscheinliche Diagnose darstellt.
at0020.1.comment: Dieses Datenelement kommt mehrfach vor, um mehr als eine Diagnose zu ermöglichen. Wenn möglich, wird eine Codierung mit einer Terminologie wie SNOMED CT bevorzugt. Dieses Datenelement ist als sich gegenseitig ausschließend zur „Bildgebenden Differenzialdiagnostik“ zu betrachten, dh jeweils nur entweder „Bildgebende Diagnostik“ oder „Bildgebende Differenzialdiagnostik“ des Archetyps „Bildgebendes Untersuchungsergebnis“. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.conclusionCode in FHIR.

at0000.1.description: Ergebnis einer bildgebenden Untersuchung, die an einer Person mit radiologischen Verfahren durchgeführt wird.

at0023.1.description: Zusätzliche Informationen über die Untersuchung, welche noch nicht an anderer Stelle dargestellt wurden.
at0023.1.comment: Zum Beispiel: eine Anmerkung, dass der Film dem Patienten gegeben wurde. Entspricht DiagnosticReport.note in FHIR.

at0091.2.description: *The type of imaging device, process or method that originally acquired or produced the data used to create the images in the study. (en)
at0091.2.comment: *For example: 'XRay', 'CT scan', 'ultrasound', 'MRI', 'bone densitometry', 'tomography', 'mammography', 'nuclear medicine', 'PET', 'angiography', and 'fluoroscopy'. This data element may be redundant if the modality is clearly represented in the 'Study name'. Alternatively it may also be possible to autopopulate the 'Modality' from a coded 'Study name'. Coding of the 'Modality' with a value set is recommended, such as the DICOM CID 29 Acquisition Modality value set. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.modality in FHIR and Modality (0008, 0060) in DICOM. (en)

at0000.description: *The result of an imaging examination performed on an individual, using radiological techniques. (en)

at0002.description: Förinställd, ospecificerad tidpunkt eller tidsintervall som kan definieras mer uttryckligen i en mall (template) eller i en applikation.

at0004.description: *The name of the imaging examination performed. (en)
at0004.comment: *For example: 'CT abdomen'; 'Doppler ultrasound of renal artery' or 'Plain chest xray'. Coding with a terminology is strongly recommended, preferably a term specifying both modality and anatomical location, where possible. Examples of candidate terminologies are the LOINC Imaging Document Codes, RadLex Playbook or SNOMED-CT. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.code in FHIR. (en)

at0006.description: *Structured detail about the body site or region targetted for imaging. (en)
at0006.comment: *If the body site is specified within the text or code for 'Study name', then this field may be redundant. (en)

at0008.description: *Narrative description or overview of all clinical findings. (en)

at0014.description: *Narrative description of relevant clinical history that provides context for the examination and interpretation of results. (en)
at0014.comment: *Alternatively this data element can include an RM link to clinical information provided in the original examination request or located elsewhere within the health record. (en)

at0020.description: Enstaka ord, fras eller kort beskrivning som representerar det troliga tillståndet eller diagnosen.
at0020.comment: *This data element has multiple occurrences to allow for more than one differential diagnosis. Coding with a terminology such as SNOMED CT is preferred, where possible. This data element should be considered as mutually exclusive to "Imaging differential diagnosis", ie only either "Imaging diagnosis" or "Imaging differential diagnosis" in each instance of the archetype "Imaging examination result." Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.conclusionCode in FHIR. (en)

at0021.description: Kortfattad och kliniskt relevant tolkning av alla bilddiagnostiska fynd, inklusive en jämförelse med tidigare studier där så är lämpligt.
at0021.comment: *Also referred to as 'Opinion' or 'Conclusion'. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.conclusion in FHIR. (en)

at0023.description: Ytterligare beskrivning av undersökningen som inte fångats i andra fält.
at0023.comment: *For example: a note that the film was given to the patient. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.note in FHIR. (en)

at0026.description: *Details about the service, organisation or individual carrying out the imaging examination. (en)

at0027.description: *Details about a single imaging examination requested. (en)

at0028.description: *Unique identifier for the imaging examination order assigned by the requester. (en)
at0028.comment: *Equivalent to the HL7 Placer Order Identifier. (en)

at0029.comment: *This can be usefule in situations where the examination requested differs from the examination performed. (en)

at0030.description: *Details about the clinician and/or organisation requesting the imaging examination. (en)

at0031.description: *Unique identifier for the imaging examination order assigned by the radiology service. (en)
at0031.comment: *Equivalent to the HL7 Filler Order Identifier or DICOM Accession number attribute (0008,0050). (en)

at0041.description: *Additional structured details of technical and clinical aspects of capturing the image/s. (en)

at0044.description: *Structured details about the imaging examination findings targeting a specific structure or region. (en)

at0045.comment: *Multiple formats are allowed but they should represent equivalent clinical content. For example a pdf version of the report. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.presentedForm in FHIR. (en)

at0046.description: Ytterligare information som krävs för att utvidga modellen med lokalt innehåll eller för anpassning till andra referensmodeller.
at0046.comment: Till exempel: lokala informationskrav eller ytterligare metadata för anpassning till FHIR.

at0048.description: Beskrivning av faktorer som inte registrerats någon annanstans, men som kan påverka fynden och/eller undersökningsresultatet.

at0049.description: *Narrative description about the radiological procedure used to capture the study. (en)
at0049.comment: *Use this data element to describe a summary of technique, including technical limitations or deviation from the normal technical procedures. For example: '5 mm axial images from the lung bases through the pubic symphysis were acquired following the administration of intravenous and oral contrast. Coronal and Sagittal reformatted images were constructed from the source data.' (en)

at0055.description: *Description of the simple body site or region targetted for imaging. (en)
at0055.comment: *If the body site is specified within the text or code for 'Study name', then this field may be redundant. Coding of 'Target body site' with a terminology, such as SNOMED CT, is desirable. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.series.bodySite in FHIR. (en)

at0056.description: *Narrative description about the comparison of this examination with previous similar studies. (en)
at0056.comment: *Also use this data element to indicate if no comparison images and/or reports are available. Details about the images used for comparison can be recorded using the 'Comparison study details' CLUSTER, within Protocol. (en)

at0057.description: *Narrative description about the quality of the examination. (en)
at0057.comment: *For example: the nature of any limitations and their impact on interpretation; recommendation that the examination should be repeated; or whether an alternative method of assessment might be more appropriate. (en)

at0058.description: Enstaka ord, fras eller kort beskrivning som representerar ett möjligt tillstånd eller en diagnos.
at0058.comment: *This data element has multiple occurrences to allow for more than one differential diagnosis. Coding with a terminology such as SNOMED CT is preferred, where possible. This data element should be considered as mutually exclusive to "Imaging diagnosis", ie only either "Imaging diagnosis" or "Imaging differential diagnosis" in each instance of the archetype "Imaging examination result." (en)

at0059.description: Förslag för ytterligare avbildning, undersökningar och/eller hänvisning och tillhörande motiv.
at0059.comment: *This data element has 0..* occurrences to allow for more than one recommendation. Formal orders for additional imaging examination, investigation should be recorded using an INSTRUCTION archetype, such as INSTRUCTION.service_request. (en)

at0061.description: *Narrative description about the reason the examination was originally requested. (en)

at0062.description: *Narrative description about the clinical procedure or other clinical considerations used to capture the study. (en)
at0062.comment: *Use this data element to describe a summary of the clinical procedure, patient positioning, interventions such as Valsalva manoeuvre, and administration of contrast agent, radiopharmaceuticals and/or treatments as part of the imaging study. For example: '80 ml of Isovue-370 was administered intravenously using a bolus-tracking technique centered on the main pulmonary artery'. It can also be used to record an overview of any issues, complications or adverse reactions encountered.  (en)

at0063.description: *Assessment about the quality of the examination. (en)
at0063.comment:
*Coding of the imaging quality with a value set is recommended. For example: 'excellent, good, fair, poor, and non-diagnostic'; or 'adequate, suboptimal and inadequate'.
 (en)

at0065.description: *Details about a series included in this report. (en)

at0067.description: *Details about an imaging series being compared to the reported study. (en)

at0069.description: *Details about imaging device/s used to capture the study. (en)

at0071.description: *The date and/or time that ‘Overall result status’ was assigned. (en)

at0072.description: *The status of the imaging examination result as a whole. (en)
at0072.comment: *The values have been aligned with the FHIR Diagnostic report status, with the exception of 'Entered in error' which is relevant only to a messaging-oriented paradigm. Other local codes/terms can be used via the Text 'choice'. In most use cases, only one status is applicable at any time, however this data element allows multiple occurrences for the use cases where there are a variety of types of status that need to be specified, usually within a template. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.status in FHIR.  (en)

at0073.description: *The existence of the study is registered, but no result is yet available. (en)

at0074.description: *This is a partial (e.g. initial, interim or preliminary) result but data may be incomplete or unverified. (en)

at0075.description: Verified early results are available, but not all results are final. This is a sub-category of 'Partial'.

at0076.description: *The result is complete and verified by an authorised person. (en)

at0077.description: *Subsequent to being final, the result has been modified. (en)

at0078.description: *Subsequent to being final, the result has been modified to correct an error. This is a sub-category of 'Amended'. (en)

at0079.description: *Subsequent to being final, the result has been modified by adding new content. The existing content is unchanged. This is a sub-category of 'Amended'. (en)

at0080.description: The result is unavailable because the test was not started or not completed (also sometimes called 'aborted').

at0083.description: *Details of additional clinicians or organisations who require a copy of the examination result. (en)
at0083.comment: The 'Distribution list' is for information-only, and that the primary recipient of the report is the person intended to act on the information.

at0087.description: *Name of the radiological procedure used to capture the study. (en)
at0087.comment: *Coding of the 'Technique' with a terminology is permitted. Multiple occurrences allow for identification of one or more techniques. (en)

at0088.description: *Identification of the clinical procedure or management used to capture the study. (en)

at0090.description: *The status of the result is not known. (en)

at0091.description: *The type of imaging device, process or method that originally acquired or produced the data used to create the images in the study. (en)
at0091.comment: *For example: 'XRay', 'CT scan', 'ultrasound', 'MRI', 'bone densitometry', 'tomography', 'mammography', 'nuclear medicine', 'PET', 'angiography', and 'fluoroscopy'. This data element may be redundant if the modality is clearly represented in the 'Study name'. Alternatively it may also be possible to autopopulate the 'Modality' from a coded 'Study name'. Coding of the 'Modality' with a value set is recommended, such as the DICOM CID 29 Acquisition Modality value set. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.modality in FHIR and Modality (0008, 0060) in DICOM. (en)

at0092.description: *Unique identifier for the imaging study assigned by the imaging device. (en)
at0092.comment: *Equivalent to Study Instance UID (0020,000D) in DICOM and ImagingStudy.identifier in FHIR. (en)

at0093.description: *Details about images from a prior study used for comparison to the reported study. (en)

at0094.description: *The name of the comparison imaging examination performed. (en)

at0095.description: *Unique identifier for the comparison imaging study. (en)

at0096.description: *Date and time the comparison examination started. (en)

at0097.description: *Digital location of the comparison imaging content and metadata. (en)
at0097.comment: *This location identifies the network service providing access (for storage, viewing, querying, or retrieval) for the study. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.endpoint in FHIR. (en)

at0098.description: *Digital location of the imaging content and metadata. (en)
at0098.comment: *This location identifies the network service providing access (for storage, viewing, querying, or retrieval) for the study. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.endpoint in FHIR. (en)

at0099.description: *The current state of the imaging study. (en)

at0100.description: *The existence of the imaging study is registered, but there is nothing yet available. (en)

at0101.description: *At least one instance has been associated with this imaging study. (en)

at0102.description: *The imaging study is unavailable because the study was not started or not completed. (en)

at0103.description: *The status is not known by the radiology source system. (en)

at0104.description: *Unique identifier for the imaging report assigned by the radiology service. (en)
at0104.comment: *As one instance of this archetype is used per study, this identifier can be used to connect more than one imaging study within a single combined report. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.identifier in FHIR.  (en)

at0105.description: *Radiology service-generated description or classification of the study. (en)
at0105.comment: *Equivalent to ImagingStudy.description in FHIR and Study description (0008, 1030) in DICOM. Possible DICOM examples: MR BREAS, UNIT; NEURO^HEAD; or MR BREASTUNI UE. (en)

at0106.description: *Link to full details of any imaging carried out during the study. (en)
at0106.comment: *Typically referencing images used the DICOM enabled modalities, but this data field provides an alternative method to access the images. Equivalent to FHIR's DiagnosticReport.imagingStudy. (en)

at0107.description: *Identification of a stabilising appliance in use. (en)

at0108.description: *Position of the individual during the imaging examination. (en)

at0091.1.description: *The type of imaging device, process or method that originally acquired or produced the data used to create the images in the study. (en)
at0091.1.comment: *For example: 'XRay', 'CT scan', 'ultrasound', 'MRI', 'bone densitometry', 'tomography', 'mammography', 'nuclear medicine', 'PET', 'angiography', and 'fluoroscopy'. This data element may be redundant if the modality is clearly represented in the 'Study name'. Alternatively it may also be possible to autopopulate the 'Modality' from a coded 'Study name'. Coding of the 'Modality' with a value set is recommended, such as the DICOM CID 29 Acquisition Modality value set. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.modality in FHIR and Modality (0008, 0060) in DICOM. (en)

at0092.1.description: *Unique identifier for the imaging study assigned by the imaging device. (en)
at0092.1.comment: *Equivalent to Study Instance UID (0020,000D) in DICOM and ImagingStudy.identifier in FHIR. (en)

at0059.1.description: Förslag för ytterligare avbildning, undersökningar och/eller hänvisning och tillhörande motiv.
at0059.1.comment: *This data element has 0..* occurrences to allow for more than one recommendation. Formal orders for additional imaging examination, investigation should be recorded using an INSTRUCTION archetype, such as INSTRUCTION.service_request. (en)

at0014.1.description: *Narrative description of relevant clinical history that provides context for the examination and interpretation of results. (en)
at0014.1.comment: *Alternatively this data element can include an RM link to clinical information provided in the original examination request or located elsewhere within the health record. (en)

at0057.1.description: *Narrative description about the quality of the examination. (en)
at0057.1.comment: *For example: the nature of any limitations and their impact on interpretation; recommendation that the examination should be repeated; or whether an alternative method of assessment might be more appropriate. (en)

at0058.1.description: Enstaka ord, fras eller kort beskrivning som representerar ett möjligt tillstånd eller en diagnos.
at0058.1.comment: *This data element has multiple occurrences to allow for more than one differential diagnosis. Coding with a terminology such as SNOMED CT is preferred, where possible. This data element should be considered as mutually exclusive to "Imaging diagnosis", ie only either "Imaging diagnosis" or "Imaging differential diagnosis" in each instance of the archetype "Imaging examination result." (en)

at0097.1.description: *Digital location of the comparison imaging content and metadata. (en)
at0097.1.comment: *This location identifies the network service providing access (for storage, viewing, querying, or retrieval) for the study. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.endpoint in FHIR. (en)

at0098.1.description: *Digital location of the imaging content and metadata. (en)
at0098.1.comment: *This location identifies the network service providing access (for storage, viewing, querying, or retrieval) for the study. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.endpoint in FHIR. (en)

at0072.1.description: *The status of the imaging examination result as a whole. (en)
at0072.1.comment: *The values have been aligned with the FHIR Diagnostic report status, with the exception of 'Entered in error' which is relevant only to a messaging-oriented paradigm. Other local codes/terms can be used via the Text 'choice'. In most use cases, only one status is applicable at any time, however this data element allows multiple occurrences for the use cases where there are a variety of types of status that need to be specified, usually within a template. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.status in FHIR.  (en)

at0099.1.description: *The current state of the imaging study. (en)

at0071.1.description: *The date and/or time that ‘Overall result status’ was assigned. (en)

at0055.1.description: *Description of the simple body site or region targetted for imaging. (en)
at0055.1.comment: *If the body site is specified within the text or code for 'Study name', then this field may be redundant. Coding of 'Target body site' with a terminology, such as SNOMED CT, is desirable. Equivalent to ImagingStudy.series.bodySite in FHIR. (en)

at0093.1.description: *Details about images from a prior study used for comparison to the reported study. (en)

at0056.1.description: *Narrative description about the comparison of this examination with previous similar studies. (en)
at0056.1.comment: *Also use this data element to indicate if no comparison images and/or reports are available. Details about the images used for comparison can be recorded using the 'Comparison study details' CLUSTER, within Protocol. (en)

at0094.1.description: *The name of the comparison imaging examination performed. (en)

at0031.1.description: *Unique identifier for the imaging examination order assigned by the radiology service. (en)
at0031.1.comment: *Equivalent to the HL7 Filler Order Identifier or DICOM Accession number attribute (0008,0050). (en)

at0095.1.description: *Unique identifier for the comparison imaging study. (en)

at0096.1.description: *Date and time the comparison examination started. (en)

at0108.1.description: *Position of the individual during the imaging examination. (en)

at0105.1.description: *Radiology service-generated description or classification of the study. (en)
at0105.1.comment: *Equivalent to ImagingStudy.description in FHIR and Study description (0008, 1030) in DICOM. Possible DICOM examples: MR BREAS, UNIT; NEURO^HEAD; or MR BREASTUNI UE. (en)

at0106.1.description: *Link to full details of any imaging carried out during the study. (en)
at0106.1.comment: *Typically referencing images used the DICOM enabled modalities, but this data field provides an alternative method to access the images. Equivalent to FHIR's DiagnosticReport.imagingStudy. (en)

at0104.1.description: *Unique identifier for the imaging report assigned by the radiology service. (en)
at0104.1.comment: *As one instance of this archetype is used per study, this identifier can be used to connect more than one imaging study within a single combined report. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.identifier in FHIR.  (en)

at0002.1.description: Förinställd, ospecificerad tidpunkt eller tidsintervall som kan definieras mer uttryckligen i en mall (template) eller i en applikation.

at0048.1.description: Beskrivning av faktorer som inte registrerats någon annanstans, men som kan påverka fynden och/eller undersökningsresultatet.

at0049.1.description: *Narrative description about the radiological procedure used to capture the study. (en)
at0049.1.comment: *Use this data element to describe a summary of technique, including technical limitations or deviation from the normal technical procedures. For example: '5 mm axial images from the lung bases through the pubic symphysis were acquired following the administration of intravenous and oral contrast. Coronal and Sagittal reformatted images were constructed from the source data.' (en)

at0004.1.description: *The name of the imaging examination performed. (en)
at0004.1.comment: *For example: 'CT abdomen'; 'Doppler ultrasound of renal artery' or 'Plain chest xray'. Coding with a terminology is strongly recommended, preferably a term specifying both modality and anatomical location, where possible. Examples of candidate terminologies are the LOINC Imaging Document Codes, RadLex Playbook or SNOMED-CT. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.code in FHIR. (en)

at0027.1.description: *Details about a single imaging examination requested. (en)

at0026.2.description: *Details about the service, organisation or individual carrying out the imaging examination. (en)

at0029.1.comment: *This can be usefule in situations where the examination requested differs from the examination performed. (en)

at0006.2.description: *Structured detail about the body site or region targetted for imaging. (en)
at0006.2.comment: *If the body site is specified within the text or code for 'Study name', then this field may be redundant. (en)

at0028.1.description: *Unique identifier for the imaging examination order assigned by the requester. (en)
at0028.1.comment: *Equivalent to the HL7 Placer Order Identifier. (en)

at0008.1.description: *Narrative description or overview of all clinical findings. (en)

at0063.1.description: *Assessment about the quality of the examination. (en)
at0063.1.comment:
*Coding of the imaging quality with a value set is recommended. For example: 'excellent, good, fair, poor, and non-diagnostic'; or 'adequate, suboptimal and inadequate'.
 (en)

at0087.1.description: *Name of the radiological procedure used to capture the study. (en)
at0087.1.comment: *Coding of the 'Technique' with a terminology is permitted. Multiple occurrences allow for identification of one or more techniques. (en)

at0062.1.description: *Narrative description about the clinical procedure or other clinical considerations used to capture the study. (en)
at0062.1.comment: *Use this data element to describe a summary of the clinical procedure, patient positioning, interventions such as Valsalva manoeuvre, and administration of contrast agent, radiopharmaceuticals and/or treatments as part of the imaging study. For example: '80 ml of Isovue-370 was administered intravenously using a bolus-tracking technique centered on the main pulmonary artery'. It can also be used to record an overview of any issues, complications or adverse reactions encountered.  (en)

at0061.1.description: *Narrative description about the reason the examination was originally requested. (en)

at0088.1.description: *Identification of the clinical procedure or management used to capture the study. (en)

at0021.1.description: Kortfattad och kliniskt relevant tolkning av alla bilddiagnostiska fynd, inklusive en jämförelse med tidigare studier där så är lämpligt.
at0021.1.comment: *Also referred to as 'Opinion' or 'Conclusion'. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.conclusion in FHIR. (en)

at0044.1.description: *Structured details about the imaging examination findings targeting a specific structure or region. (en)

at0020.1.description: Enstaka ord, fras eller kort beskrivning som representerar det troliga tillståndet eller diagnosen.
at0020.1.comment: *This data element has multiple occurrences to allow for more than one differential diagnosis. Coding with a terminology such as SNOMED CT is preferred, where possible. This data element should be considered as mutually exclusive to "Imaging differential diagnosis", ie only either "Imaging diagnosis" or "Imaging differential diagnosis" in each instance of the archetype "Imaging examination result." Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.conclusionCode in FHIR. (en)

at0000.1.description: *The result of an imaging examination performed on an individual, using radiological techniques. (en)

at0023.1.description: Ytterligare beskrivning av undersökningen som inte fångats i andra fält.
at0023.1.comment: *For example: a note that the film was given to the patient. Equivalent to DiagnosticReport.note in FHIR. (en)

nb.purpose: For å registrere funn observert under fysisk undersøkelse av en spesifikk makroskopisk lokalisert strukturell endring av eller skade på normalt vev.
keywords: skade, sår, makel, papel, pustel, vesikkel, erytem, bulla, urtica, akne, follikulitt, nodulus, noduli, nevus, nevi, føflekk, tumor, lichen, lichenifisering, dermatitt, fissur, komedon, cyste, infiltrasjon, indurasjon, teleangiektiase, petekkie, deskvamasjon, hyperkeratose, kruste, erosjon, ulcus, ekskoriasjon, cicatrix, hypertrofisk, arr, keloid, atrofi, stria, callus, poikiloderma, alopecia, hypertrikose, follikulitt, furunkel, karbunkel, abscess, cellulitt, purpura, ekkymose, suggilasjon, hematom, milier, verruca
nb.use:
Brukes for å registrere funn observert under fysisk undersøkelse av en spesifikk makroskopisk lokalisert strukturell endring av eller skade på normalt vev.

Denne arketypen er ment for å brukes til å beskrive enkeltstående lokaliserte lesjoner. For å beskrive lokaliserte samlinger av lesjoner som for eksempel grupper av føflekker, må det brukes en annen passende CLUSTER-arketype. Denne arketypen kan nøstes inni en slik arketype for å beskrive enkeltlesjoner som er del av en samling.

Denne arketypen er spesifikt designet for å brukes i SLOTet "Undersøkelsesfunn" i arketypen OBSERVATION.exam, CLUSTER.exam-skin, eller andre CLUSTER.exam-arketyper. Den kan imidlertid også brukes i hvilken som helst annen OBSERVATION-, ACTION- eller CLUSTER-arketype der det er klinisk passende. For eksempel CLUSTER.exam-breast eller CLUSTER.exam-penis.

Denne arketypen kan spesialiseres for å støtte registrering av detaljer som kun er relevante for en undergruppe av lesjoner. Et eksempel på dette kan være å spesialisere arketypen for sår, for å kunne registrere informasjon om sårkanter, sårbunn, undergraving eller sårvæske.

Bruk for å registrere fritekstbeskrivelser av kliniske funn fra eksisterende eller tidligere løsninger i et arketypeformat, ved hjelp av elementet "Klinisk beskrivelse".
nb.misuse:
Brukes ikke for å registrere funn om en radiologisk lesjon. Bruk arketypen CLUSTER.imaging_exam-abnormality for dette formålet.

Brukes ikke for å registrere funn om utbrudd som dekker hele kroppen eller et helt organ, som for eksempel vannkopper som dekker hele hudoverflaten. Bruk arketypen CLUSTER.symptom_sign for dette formålet.

Brukes ikke for å registrere en makroskopisk patologiundersøkelse av prøvemateriale fra en lesjon. Bruk en passende CLUSTER-arketype innenfor arketypen OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result.

Brukes ikke for å registrere den kliniske historikken for en lesjon. Bruk spesifikke OBSERVATION- og CLUSTER-arketyper, for eksempel OBSERVATION.story og CLUSTER.symptom_sign.

pt-br.purpose: *For recording findings observed during the physical examination of an identified macroscopic localised structural change of, or damage to, normal tissue. (en)
keywords: *injury, wound, ulcer, macule, papule, patch, plaque, vesicle, bulla, erosion, fissure, excoriation, nodule, tumor, tumour, burrow, pits, abscess, carbuncle, cyst, furuncle, pustule, vesicle, hematoma, haematoma, purpura, petechiae, telangiectasia, weal, wheal, urticaria, scale, atrophy, incision, incised, puncture, contusion, bruise, abrasion, laceration, maceration, burn, frostbite (en)
pt-br.use:
*Use for recording findings observed during the physical examination of an identified macroscopic localised structural change or damage to normal tissue. This archetype is intended to be used to describe both benign and malignant lesions.

This archetype is intended to be used to describe single localised lesions. To describe localised clusters of lesions such as a cluster of moles, use an appropriate CLUSTER archetype. This archetype may be nested inside such an archetype to describe single lesions which are part of the cluster.

This archetype has been specifically designed to be used in the 'Examination findings' SLOT within the CLUSTER.exam_skin or other OBSERVATION.exam archetypes, but can also be used within any other OBSERVATION, ACTION or CLUSTER archetypes, where clinically appropriate - for example, CLUSTER.exam_breast or CLUSTER.exam_penis.

This archetype may be specialised to enable recording details only relevant to a subset of lesions. An example of this can be specialising the archetype for wounds/ulcers, to allow recording information about wound edges, wound bed, undermining, or exudate.

Use to incorporate the narrative descriptions of clinical findings within existing or legacy clinical systems into an archetyped format, using the 'Clinical Description' data element. (en)
pt-br.misuse:
*Not to be used to record findings about an imaging lesion. Use the CLUSTER.imaging_exam-abnormality archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used to record findings about non-localised or whole-organ eruptions such as a chickenpox rash covering the entire skin surface. Use the CLUSTER.symptom_sign archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used to record a macroscopic pathology examination of a specimen from a lesion. Use an appropriate CLUSTER archetype within the OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result archetype.

Not to be used for recording the clinical history of a lesion - use specific OBSERVATION and CLUSTER archetypes, for example OBSERVATION.story and CLUSTER.symptom_sign. (en)

at0001.description: Spesifisering av kroppsstedet hvor den undersøkte lesjonen befinner seg.
at0001.comment: "Kroppssted" bør kodes med en terminologi, der dette er mulig. For eksempel høyre kne, ganen, sakrum eller duodenum. Dersom kroppsstedet allerede er angitt i SLOTet "Strukturert kroppssted" eller i en annen arketype denne arketypen er nøstet inni, kan dette dataelementet være overflødig.

at0002.description: Spesifisering av typen lesjon som er undersøkt.
at0002.comment: "Type lesjon" bør kodes med en terminologi, der det er mulig. For eksempel føflekk, hevelse, depigmentert område, rift, hematom, kirurgisk snitt, arr, basalcellekarsinom, venøst leggsår eller slimhinnepolypp. For noen bruksområder kjent som "primær morfologi".

at0006.comment: Den klinisk tolkningen kan kodes med en terminologi, der dette er passende.

at0007.description: Ytterligere fritekst om undersøkelsesfunnene, som ikke fanges opp i andre felt.

at0012.description: Identifisering av lesjonen ved bruk av en merkelapp, for å skille en lesjon fra lignende lesjoner ved det samme kroppsstedet.
at0012.comment: For eksempel "Føflekk nr 1" som markert på et diagram over kroppsstedet.

at0014.description: Lesjonens høyde eller dybde over eller under den omkringliggende organoverflaten.

at0015.comment: "Form" bør kodes med en terminologi, der det er mulig. For eksempel "stilket" eller "sirkulær". For noen bruksområder kjent som "sekundær morfologi".

at0006.1.description: Enkeltord, frase eller kort beskrivelse som representerer den kliniske betydningen av undersøkelsesfunnene.
at0006.1.comment: Den klinisk tolkningen kan kodes med en terminologi, der dette er passende.

at0007.1.description: Ytterligere fritekst om undersøkelsesfunnene, som ikke fanges opp i andre felt.

at0000.1.description: Funn observert under fysisk undersøkelse av en spesifikk makroskopisk lokalisert strukturell endring av eller skade på normalt vev.

at0012.1.description: Identifisering av lesjonen ved bruk av en merkelapp, for å skille en lesjon fra lignende lesjoner ved det samme kroppsstedet.
at0012.1.comment: For eksempel "Føflekk nr 1" som markert på et diagram over kroppsstedet.

at0001.1.description: Spesifisering av kroppsstedet hvor den undersøkte lesjonen befinner seg.
at0001.1.comment: "Kroppssted" bør kodes med en terminologi, der dette er mulig. For eksempel høyre kne, ganen, sakrum eller duodenum. Dersom kroppsstedet allerede er angitt i SLOTet "Strukturert kroppssted" eller i en annen arketype denne arketypen er nøstet inni, kan dette dataelementet være overflødig.

en.purpose: For the recording of identifier details aligned with corresponding FHIR resource or data types.
en.use:
Use to record identifier details aligned with the corresponding FHIR resources or data types.

This cluster archetype is intended to be used inside the Identifier slot in any FHIR resource-aligned archetypes. These may be clusters themselves or entry archetypes.

at0000.description: Identifier details aligned with FHIR resources or data types.

at0007.description: The start of the period. The boundary is inclusive.

at0008.description: The end of the period. If the end of the period is missing, it means that the period is ongoing. The start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at that time.
